about.name: history
about.info:
جامعة الزقازيق الأهلية هي جامعة غير هادفة للربح وتهتم بالتمير في التعليم والبحث العلمي وتدعمها الدولة؛
تقع في موقع متميز بين الطريق الموازي لطريق مصر إسماعيلية الصحراوي و الطريق الدائري الإقليمي وطريق بلبيس العاشر الزقازيق، محافظة الشرقية, وتقوم على مساحة 44 فدان وفقا لنظم الجامعات الذكية وتضم عدة مباني منها، مبنى إدارة الجامعة بالإضافة إلى المباني الإدارية، والمباني الأكاديمية الخاصة بالقطاعات الطبية والهندسية، والعلوم الإنسانية، ومباني المعامل والورش، والساحات الأكاديمية والإدارية، والمناطق الترفيهية والرياضية
تسهم الجامعة في إتاحة تعليم ذي جودة عالية عبر برامج تعليمية متطورة ومواكبة للعصر وتتبنى معايير الجودة المصرية والعالمية وكذلك ربط عملية التعليم ومخرجاته بأولويات سوق العمل.
كما تدير الجامعة الأهلية نخبة من القيادات الجامعية المتميزة (رؤساء ونواب وعمداء والأمناء) من متخصصين لهم قدرة على القيادة والسعي للتميز العالمي .
تتميز الجامعة بمجموعة متكاملة من البرامج الدراسية غير التقليدية بنظام الساعات المعتمدة صممت هذه البرامج الدراسية  لتتواكب مع سوق العمل العالمي، والمتوافقة مع معايير الجودة المحلية والدولية.
كلية الطب البشرى برنامج الطب والجراحة العامة
كلية طب وجراحة الفم والأسنان برنامج طب وجراحة الفم والأسنان
كلية الهندسة
برنامج هندسة الإنشاءات وإدارة التشييد
برنامج ميكاترونيكس
كلية حاسبات ومعلومات برنامج نظم معلومات الطيران

about.name: goals
about.info:
تهدف جامعة الزقازيق الأهلية إلى المساهمة الفعالة في إعداد الشباب علمياً وخلقياً ليكونوا قادرين على المنافسة في العلم وفي العمل، والقيام بدور قيادي وتنويري في نهضة المجتمع، كما تهدف الجامعة إلى بناء شبكة واسعة من العلاقات الأكاديمية والبحثية والثقافية مع الجامعات ومراكز البحوث المتميزة محلياً وإقليمياً ودولياً في شتى المجالات بما يحقق الربط بين أهداف الجامعة واحتياجات المجتمع المتطورة وأداء الخدمات البحثية للغير، حيث تسعى الجامعة لتحقيق الأهداف التالية
توفير الخريجين فى التخصصات المختلفة طبقا لاحتياجات السوق المحلي والعالمي وتخفيف اعباء الكثافة الطلابية في الجامعات الحكومية.
 فتح قنوات للتعاون في مجال التعليم والبحث العلمي والإنتاج مع القطاعات المختلفة على المستوى المحلي والعالمي.
تقديم خدمه تعليمية متميزة تساعد على اعداد خريج متميز يستفيد منه سوق العمل المحلي والعالمي.
تبني سياسة تعليمية تعتمد على ربط المقررات الدراسية التي يدرسها الطالب واحتياجات سوق العمل المحلي والخارجي, مع التركيز على دعم الدراسة التطبيقية المرتبطة بالتخصص وذلك عن طريق توفير فرص التدريب العملي داخليا وخارجيا
 عقد إتفاقيات للتعاون مع الجامعات العالمية للإشتراك في التدريس والإشراف على البرامج الأكاديمية والبرامج التدريبية وإجراء البحوث التطبيقية وإستيفاء معايير الجودة والإعتماد المطبقة بها.
 وضع برامج ومناهج أكاديمية متميزة إسترشادا بالتقدم في العلوم والتكنولوجيا وباحتياجات السوق المصري والعالمي, مع وضع آلية لتحقيق الترابط فيما بين الجامعة وسوق العمل والخريجين.
 إنشاء المراكز البحثية المتخصصة التى تساهم في حل المشاكل الإجتماعية والصناعية وتطوير الصناعات والخدمات القائمة وخدمة المجتمع فى جمهورية مصر العربية والشرق الأوسط.
تأسيس نظام لإدارة ومتابعة الجودة داخل الجامعة بما يضمن رفع مستوى الأداء على كافة المستويات سواء كانت تعليمية أو إدارية أو بحثية أو خدمة مجتمع.

about.name: vision
about.info: أن نكون مؤسسة أكاديمية رائدة معترفًا بها عالميًا في التميز التعليمي والبحثي والابتكار، من خلال تمكين الطلاب ليصبحوا قادة أخلاقيين ومساهمين فاعلين في خدمة المجتمع.

news.title: University Hosts International Conference on Sustainable Development and Innovation
news.description:
The university proudly hosted the International Conference on Sustainable Development and Innovation.
Over 500 researchers and students from 20 countries participated.
Keynote speakers addressed urgent environmental and technological challenges.
Workshops focused on renewable energy, smart cities, and green technology.
Faculty and graduate students presented over 150 research papers.
The event fostered global partnerships between institutions.
Delegates praised the university's organization and vibrant academic environment.
The conference concluded with a commitment to publish a joint research journal.
Plans for future collaborations and student exchange programs were initiated.
Attendees enjoyed a tour of the university's sustainable campus projects.

news.title: University Launches New Master's Program in Artificial Intelligence and Data Science
news.description:
The Faculty of Computer Science announced a new master's program in Artificial Intelligence and Data Science.
The program aims to meet the growing industry demand for AI specialists.
It offers a curriculum combining theory, practical applications, and ethics.
State-of-the-art labs have been set up to support advanced learning.
The program includes partnerships with leading tech firms for internships.
Students will work on real-world projects guided by expert faculty.
Scholarships are available for outstanding applicants.
Graduates are expected to lead innovations in AI across industries.
The new program positions the university as a pioneer in AI education.
Applications for the fall semester are now officially open.

news.title: University Medical Center Achieves Accreditation for Excellence in Healthcare Services
news.description:
The university's Medical Center earned prestigious national accreditation for healthcare excellence.
Inspectors praised the center’s advanced facilities and patient-centered care.
Over 200 healthcare professionals participated in the accreditation process.
The center offers specialized clinics in cardiology, oncology, and pediatrics.
A new emergency wing is under construction to expand services.
Medical students benefit from hands-on training in real hospital settings.
The accreditation reflects the university’s commitment to community health.
Ongoing staff development ensures the highest standards of patient care.
The achievement strengthens the university's reputation nationally.
Celebrations included a recognition ceremony for medical staff and students.

news.title: University Library Expands Digital Resources with New Research Databases
news.description:
The university library has significantly expanded its digital collection.
New subscriptions to international research databases have been added.
Students now have access to millions of scholarly articles and journals.
A dedicated training center helps students utilize digital resources effectively.
The library also launched an online portal for remote access.
Faculty members contributed to building customized subject guides.
Workshops on academic writing and plagiarism prevention are ongoing.
Special grants were provided to support open-access publishing.
The digital expansion aligns with the university’s vision for academic excellence.
Students and researchers have welcomed the new additions enthusiastically.

news.title: Engineering Students Win National Robotics Competition for the Third Consecutive Year
news.description:
A team of engineering students has once again clinched the national robotics championship.
Their innovative autonomous robot impressed judges with its efficiency and precision.
The team faced tough competition from leading universities nationwide.
Mentors from the Mechanical and Electrical Engineering departments provided guidance.
The robot was designed to solve real-world industrial challenges.
Students credited their success to months of hard work and teamwork.
The university administration honored the winners in a special ceremony.
Winning teams received scholarships and opportunities to compete internationally.
The project will soon be published in a peer-reviewed robotics journal.
Future plans include commercializing the winning design with industry partners.

news.title: New Green Campus Project to Transform University Facilities with Renewable Energy
news.description:
The university launched an ambitious Green Campus initiative to promote sustainability.
Solar panels are being installed across all major buildings.
Rainwater harvesting systems are under construction to conserve water.
The new project will reduce carbon emissions by 40% over five years.
Sustainability-focused student organizations are actively participating.
Workshops on eco-friendly living will be offered to all students.
Campus transport will shift to electric vehicles starting next year.
A new botanical garden is being developed as part of the project.
Faculty research into green technologies is receiving additional funding.
The project positions the university as a national leader in environmental responsibility.

news.title: University Hosts Career Fair with Top International Companies Offering Opportunities
news.description:
Thousands of students attended the university’s largest-ever career fair this semester.
Over 100 national and international companies participated.
Representatives from tech, finance, healthcare, and manufacturing industries were present.
Many students secured internships and job offers during the event.
Career workshops on resume writing and interview skills were provided.
Faculty and career advisors offered one-on-one counseling sessions.
New partnerships with companies were announced to support future graduates.
The event highlighted the university’s commitment to student employability.
Students praised the fair’s organization and breadth of opportunities.
Plans are already underway to expand the fair next year to even more sectors.

news.title: Faculty of Business Launches Entrepreneurship Incubator for Students
news.description:
The Faculty of Business officially launched a new Entrepreneurship Incubator.
The incubator aims to transform student ideas into successful startups.
Early-stage funding and mentoring programs are available for participants.
Workshops on business modeling, pitching, and marketing strategies are offered.
Successful alumni entrepreneurs will serve as mentors.
Collaborations with venture capitalists and investors have been established.
A co-working space equipped with modern resources was inaugurated.
The incubator will host annual pitch competitions to reward innovative projects.
This initiative reflects the university’s strategy to promote innovation.
Applications for the first cohort of student entrepreneurs are now open.

news.title: University Launches Community Service Initiative to Support Local Schools
news.description:
The university launched a new community service program targeting local schools.
Student volunteers offer tutoring and mentoring in mathematics and science.
Education and psychology majors lead specialized training sessions for volunteers.
The initiative has already benefited over 300 school students.
Workshops for teachers on digital education tools are being organized.
Community service hours are now a requirement for graduation.
The program strengthens ties between the university and the local community.
Faculty and administration have pledged ongoing support and resources.
Annual awards will recognize outstanding student volunteers.
Plans to expand the initiative to rural areas are underway.

news.title: University Celebrates Graduation Ceremony for the Class of 2025
news.description:
The university celebrated the graduation of the Class of 2025 with a grand ceremony.
Over 5,000 students received their degrees across various faculties.
Distinguished alumni and government officials attended as guest speakers.
Inspirational speeches emphasized resilience, innovation, and leadership.
The top students from each faculty were honored with awards.
Parents and families joined the celebration both in-person and online.
Graduates expressed pride in their university journey and achievements.
The event was broadcast live on multiple platforms for broader access.
Colorful decorations and musical performances added to the festive atmosphere.
Graduates are now embarking on new journeys in careers and academia.

faculties.name: Engineering
faculties.WhyUs:
The Faculty of Informatics and Computer Science at the British University in Egypt is an effective and modern Faculty offering a diverse range of specializations. The overall mission of the Faculty is to provide Egypt and the Middle East with the highest quality of British education, and to prepare graduates that feed and stimulate industry and commercial activities.
In 2017, the Faculty of Informatics and Computer is the first private Faculty that acquires the National Authority for Quality Assurance and Accreditation of Education (NAQAAE).
The program offers a broad understanding of Informatics and Computer Science and allows you to specialize in one of the following specific areas:
Computer Science (CS): is based on logical thinking and programming. It has full coverage of computer science modules and skills.
Software Engineering (SE): combines the science and technology of design, as well as the implementation and maintenance of software. Software engineering program prepares the students to apply a structured approach to the development of a software.
Computer Networks (CN): is designed to give you knowledge of both wired and wireless technology to enable you to enter a career in this fast-paced industry.
Information Systems (IS): covers key business modules, which enables the students to be fully aware of what is going on in the industry field. It gives the student a hand on how to model a business process and analyze it.
Artificial Intelligent (AI): Understand and effectively apply main artificial intelligence and robotics knowledge, to solve different real life problems intelligently and efficiently.
Graduates earn two degrees awarded by both the British University in Egypt and London South Bank University (UK).
faculties.description: The Faculty of Engineering offers advanced education in various engineering disciplines and promotes research and innovation.
faculties.admission:
English Language or English Literature
Chemistry
Physics
Mathematics
Advanced Mathematics or SAT II or its equivalent of ACT II & EST II
(Four) other approved subjects
The considered subjects of SAT II or its equivalent of ACT II & EST II are (Mathematics and any other subject of Biology, Chemistry or Physics) with a minimum score of 900
In case of Science section; (Biology is accepted) provided that applicant must have successfully completed Advanced Mathematics Subject decided by the Egyptian Ministry of Higher Education to be eligible for the Faculty of Informatics & Computer Science.

departments.name: Computer Engineering
departments.head: Dr. Yasser Ali
departments.description: The Computer Engineering Department focuses on the integration of hardware and software systems. It offers students the skills to design embedded systems, computer architectures, and real-time computing solutions. Students are trained in modern programming languages, digital systems, and microcontroller-based applications. The department promotes innovation through senior projects and industry collaboration. Research areas include IoT, robotics, and parallel computing systems.

departments.name: Civil Engineering
departments.head: Dr. Maha Fathy
departments.description: The Civil Engineering Department prepares students to design, construct, and maintain infrastructure. The curriculum covers structural analysis, concrete and steel design, soil mechanics, and transportation systems. Students engage in lab work and field studies to apply theoretical knowledge. Sustainability and green building practices are also emphasized. Graduates contribute to major infrastructure projects including bridges, highways, and water systems.

departments.name: Architecture Engineering
departments.head: Dr. Amina Salem
departments.description: The Architecture Engineering Department merges aesthetics with engineering principles to design functional spaces. Students explore architectural theory, urban planning, and sustainable design. Courses include construction techniques, CAD software, and historical architecture. The department fosters creativity and innovation while adhering to engineering safety standards. Students often participate in design competitions and real-world architectural projects.

departments.name: Electrical Engineering
departments.head: Dr. Osama Naguib
departments.description: The Electrical Engineering Department focuses on power systems, electronics, and communication technologies. Students gain a deep understanding of circuit theory, control systems, and digital electronics. Advanced topics include renewable energy, smart grids, and embedded system design. The department offers state-of-the-art labs for practical training. Many graduates work in industrial automation, telecommunications, and national energy projects.

departments.name: Mechanical Engineering
departments.head: Dr. Tarek Zaki
departments.description: Mechanical Engineering blends principles of physics, mathematics, and material science to design and manufacture mechanical systems. The department offers courses in thermodynamics, fluid dynamics, mechanics, and CAD modeling. Emphasis is placed on problem-solving and engineering design processes. Students gain hands-on experience through labs and workshops. Applications include automotive systems, heating/cooling systems, and industrial machinery.

departments.name: Mechatronics Engineering
departments.head: Dr. Heba Kamal
departments.description: Mechatronics Engineering combines mechanical, electrical, computer, and control engineering. The department trains students to design smart machines, robotics systems, and automated manufacturing solutions. Core areas include sensors and actuators, microcontrollers, and intelligent control systems. The interdisciplinary curriculum fosters innovation in emerging technologies. Projects often involve AI-integrated robotic systems and IoT-based applications.

doctors.name: Dr. Hossam El Din Mahmoud
doctors.bio: Dr. Hossam El Din Mahmoud is a distinguished academic leader with over 25 years of experience in higher education. He has held several senior administrative positions and contributed significantly to strategic development within the university. His leadership is characterized by a strong emphasis on research, innovation, and student success. Dr. Hossam is a published author in the field of educational management and policy reform. He is also recognized for fostering international academic partnerships and advancing institutional accreditation efforts.
research: Impact of Strategic Planning on University Performance – Journal of Higher Ed, 2021
Educational Reform and Quality Assurance in the MENA Region – Int. Review of Education, 2019
Leadership Styles in Academia – Comparative Education Studies, 2017

doctors.name: Dr. Noura El Sayed
doctors.bio: Dr. Noura El Sayed is a highly respected academic and administrator with extensive experience in computer and information sciences. She has led numerous initiatives to modernize the faculty's curriculum and integrate emerging technologies in education. As Dean, she has successfully implemented interdisciplinary programs and fostered collaborations with industry leaders. Dr. Noura is passionate about empowering female students in STEM fields and has launched several mentorship programs. Her research interests include data security, digital education frameworks, and institutional innovation.
cv: Dean, Faculty of Computer and Information Sciences (2020–Present)

doctors.responsibility: Faculty Vice Dean for Education and Student Affairs
doctors.bio: Dr. Mahmoud Adel is a dedicated academic leader focused on enhancing the student experience and advancing educational practices. With a strong background in curriculum design and academic advising, he has played a key role in revamping course structures and implementing student-centered learning models. Dr. Adel is known for his innovative approach to student affairs, promoting active learning environments and inclusive policies. He also serves as a liaison between students and administration, ensuring smooth academic operations. His interests lie in educational technology, academic policy development, and student engagement strategies.

doctors.responsibility: Faculty Vice Dean for Postgraduate Studies and Research
doctors.bio: Dr. Yasmine Farouk specializes in research development and postgraduate education strategy. She has over 15 years of experience leading research programs and supervising postgraduate studies. Her leadership has contributed to a significant increase in international research collaboration within the faculty. Dr. Farouk is an advocate for interdisciplinary research and supports young researchers in securing funding and publishing their work. Her focus includes creating policies that enhance academic integrity, research quality, and institutional reputation.

doctors.bio: Dr. Ayman Kotb is an accomplished academic and department head with a focus on modernizing computer science curricula. He has introduced industry-aligned courses and championed experiential learning through capstone projects and internships. Under his leadership, the department has seen an increase in graduate employability and research output. Dr. Kotb is passionate about computer architecture, distributed systems, and mentoring student innovation teams. His contributions extend to national academic policy development and accreditation standards.

doctors.name: Dr. Rania Fouad
doctors.bio: Dr. Rania Fouad leads the Information Systems Department with a vision of integrating technology and business strategy into education. She has over a decade of experience in enterprise systems, IT governance, and data-driven decision making. Her leadership has driven departmental excellence through curriculum reform and strategic partnerships with tech firms. Dr. Fouad frequently consults on digital transformation projects and mentors students in enterprise architecture and analytics.

doctors.bio: Dr. Tarek Hassan is the Head of the Information Technology Department, specializing in IT infrastructure, network security, and cloud computing. With more than 15 years of experience in academia and industry, he has developed innovative systems for data protection and network management. Dr. Hassan has published widely in top-tier journals and is an active speaker at global tech conferences. His department thrives under his leadership, focusing on both theoretical knowledge and practical skills for students.

doctors.name: Dr. Salma Khaled
doctors.bio: Dr. Salma Khaled heads the Software Engineering Department and is passionate about bridging the gap between software development and real-world applications. She has extensive experience in both academia and industry, specializing in software architecture, mobile app development, and agile methodologies. Dr. Khaled’s research focuses on improving software lifecycle processes, and she is a frequent contributor to conferences and workshops on software development best practices.

doctors.name: Dr. Amr Saeed
doctors.bio: Dr. Amr Saeed is the Head of the Artificial Intelligence Department, specializing in machine learning, deep learning, and natural language processing. With a decade of research and industry experience, Dr. Saeed is at the forefront of AI research, developing models for real-world applications in healthcare and automation. His work has been published in prestigious journals, and he is a sought-after speaker at AI conferences worldwide. He leads projects that integrate AI into various sectors, including robotics and autonomous systems.

doctors.name: Dr. Nourhan Ashraf

faculties.name: Medicine
faculties.WhyUs:
The Faculty of Medicine at our university is dedicated to providing world-class education, clinical skills training, and healthcare research.
The mission of the Faculty is to offer students a comprehensive and modern medical education that prepares them for a wide range of careers in medicine, healthcare, and medical research.
The Faculty is committed to producing graduates who can contribute to the advancement of healthcare and play an essential role in improving public health.
We are accredited by leading medical organizations and provide state-of-the-art facilities for both education and clinical practice.
Our partnerships with top hospitals and healthcare institutions ensure that students gain valuable hands-on experience.
The program covers a broad spectrum of medical fields, including:
- General Medicine: For those interested in diagnostics, treatment, and patient care.
- Surgery: Students learn surgical procedures, techniques, and patient management.
- Obstetrics and Gynecology: Specializing in women's health and reproductive medicine.
- Pediatrics: Focused on the care of infants, children, and adolescents.
- Medical Research: Equip students with the knowledge to conduct impactful research that contributes to medical advancements.
Graduates earn a degree in Medicine, with opportunities for specialization in various medical fields.
faculties.description:
The Faculty of Medicine is committed to excellence in teaching, research, and healthcare, offering an enriching experience to students through a robust curriculum, clinical exposure, and research opportunities.
Our programs ensure students are well-prepared for careers in healthcare and medical research.
faculties.admission:
English Language or English Literature
Biology
Chemistry
Physics
Mathematics or Advanced Mathematics (required for some specializations)
The considered subjects of SAT II or its equivalent of ACT II & EST II are (Biology, Chemistry, or Physics) with a minimum score of 900
In case of Science section; (Biology is accepted) provided that the applicant must have successfully completed Advanced Mathematics Subject as determined by the Egyptian Ministry of Higher Education to be eligible for the Faculty of Medicine.

departments.name: General Medicine
departments.head: Dr. Ahmed El-Gohary
departments.description: The General Medicine department provides students with a comprehensive understanding of medical sciences, clinical examination, and diagnostic skills. The department emphasizes patient-centered care, clinical problem-solving, and treatment protocols. It prepares students for a wide variety of medical specialties through hands-on practice and clinical rotations.

departments.head: Dr. Mohamed El-Nashar
departments.description: The Surgery department covers a broad range of surgical specialties, including general surgery, orthopedic surgery, and trauma care. Students gain practical experience in operating rooms, surgical techniques, and post-operative care. The department uses simulation-based education alongside clinical rotations in hospitals to develop skilled surgeons.

departments.head: Dr. Laila Abdel-Kader
departments.description: The Obstetrics and Gynecology department focuses on women's health, including pregnancy, childbirth, and reproductive system disorders. The department provides clinical exposure in prenatal care, delivery, and postnatal care, along with the diagnosis and treatment of gynecological conditions.

faculties.name: Computer Science
faculties.WhyUs:
The Faculty of Computer Science at our university is dedicated to providing a world-class education in the field of computing.
Our mission is to offer students a comprehensive education that blends theory with practical skills, preparing them for careers in software development, computer networks, AI, and data science.
We provide state-of-the-art facilities, a strong academic foundation, and real-world exposure through internships and projects.
The program covers a wide array of topics, including:
- Software Engineering: Learn the fundamentals of designing, developing, and maintaining software applications.
- Artificial Intelligence: Equip students with the skills to develop intelligent systems that solve real-world problems.
- Cybersecurity: Focus on protecting computer systems, networks, and data from malicious attacks.
- Computer Networks: Gain a thorough understanding of network design, protocols, and administration.
- Data Science: Learn to analyze and interpret large sets of data to make data-driven decisions.
Graduates earn a degree in Computer Science, with options to specialize in various cutting-edge fields of technology.
faculties.description:
The Faculty of Computer Science is committed to excellence in teaching, research, and technology development.
The Faculty provides cutting-edge education in various domains of computer science, including software development, artificial intelligence, and data science.
The Faculty aims to equip students with the knowledge and skills required to excel in the ever-evolving tech industry.
Through research initiatives and collaboration with leading tech companies, the Faculty ensures that its graduates are at the forefront of technological innovation.
The goal is to foster a deep understanding of computer science principles and their real-world applications, enabling students to contribute meaningfully to society and the global tech ecosystem.
faculties.admission:
English Language or English Literature
Chemistry
Physics
Mathematics
Advanced Mathematics or SAT II or its equivalent of ACT II & EST II
(Four) other approved subjects
The considered subjects of SAT II or its equivalent of ACT II & EST II are (Mathematics and any other subject of Biology, Chemistry or Physics) with a minimum score of 900
In case of Science section; (Biology is accepted) provided that applicant must have successfully completed Advanced Mathematics Subject decided by the Egyptian Ministry of Higher Education to be eligible for the Faculty of Informatics & Computer Science.

departments.name: Artificial Intelligence
departments.head: Dr. Yasmine El-Banna
departments.description: The Artificial Intelligence department explores machine learning, deep learning, computer vision, and natural language processing. Students engage with state-of-the-art models and tools to solve real-world problems using intelligent systems. Projects include facial recognition systems, recommendation engines, and AI-powered assistants.

departments.name: Software Engineering
departments.head: Dr. Mahmoud Helmy
departments.description: The Software Engineering department emphasizes design, development, and maintenance of scalable and robust software systems. Students learn modern programming practices, agile methodologies, and full-stack development. Industry collaboration is central, with projects simulating real-life software development environments.

departments.name: Cybersecurity
departments.head: Dr. Khaled Ali
departments.description: The Cybersecurity department focuses on protecting systems, networks, and data from cyber threats. Students gain expertise in ethical hacking, cryptography, network security, and digital forensics. The department’s labs feature real-world simulations of cyber-attacks and defensive strategies.

departments.name: Data Science
departments.head: Dr. Rasha Mahmoud
departments.description: The Data Science department specializes in data collection, analysis, and interpretation. Students develop skills in machine learning, data visualization, and big data technologies to extract actionable insights. Projects focus on predictive modeling, data mining, and statistical analysis.

departments.name: Cloud Computing
departments.head: Dr. Mohamed Taha
departments.description: The Cloud Computing department covers topics in distributed systems, cloud architecture, and cloud services. Students learn to design and manage cloud-based applications and services using platforms such as AWS, Microsoft Azure, and Google Cloud. Projects involve creating scalable and resilient cloud solutions for enterprises.

faculties.name: Pharmacy
faculties.WhyUs:
The Faculty of Informatics and Computer Science at the British University in Egypt is an effective and modern Faculty offering a diverse range of specializations. The overall mission of the Faculty is to provide Egypt and the Middle East with the highest quality of British education, and to prepare graduates that feed and stimulate industry and commercial activities.
In 2017, the Faculty of Informatics and Computer is the first private Faculty that acquires the National Authority for Quality Assurance and Accreditation of Education (NAQAAE).
The program offers a broad understanding of Informatics and Computer Science and allows you to specialize in one of the following specific areas:
Computer Science (CS): is based on logical thinking and programming. It has full coverage of computer science modules and skills.
Software Engineering (SE): combines the science and technology of design, as well as the implementation and maintenance of software. Software engineering program prepares the students to apply a structured approach to the development of a software.
Computer Networks (CN): is designed to give you knowledge of both wired and wireless technology to enable you to enter a career in this fast-paced industry.
Information Systems (IS): covers key business modules, which enables the students to be fully aware of what is going on in the industry field. It gives the student a hand on how to model a business process and analyze it.
Artificial Intelligent (AI): Understand and effectively apply main artificial intelligence and robotics knowledge, to solve different real life problems intelligently and efficiently.
Graduates earn two degrees awarded by both the British University in Egypt and London South Bank University (UK).
faculties.description: The Faculty of Pharmacy educates students in pharmaceutical sciences, clinical pharmacy, and drug development.
faculties.admission:
English Language or English Literature
Chemistry
Physics
Mathematics
Advanced Mathematics or SAT II or its equivalent of ACT II & EST II
(Four) other approved subjects
The considered subjects of SAT II or its equivalent of ACT II & EST II are (Mathematics and any other subject of Biology, Chemistry or Physics) with a minimum score of 900
In case of Science section; (Biology is accepted) provided that applicant must have successfully completed Advanced Mathematics Subject decided by the Egyptian Ministry of Higher Education to be eligible for the Faculty of Informatics & Computer Science.

departments.name: Pharmacology and Toxicology
departments.head: Dr. Khaled El-Masry
departments.description: The Pharmacology and Toxicology department studies the effects of drugs on the human body and explores toxic substances that could harm living organisms. Students engage with pharmacological agents and methods to understand therapeutic uses, toxicity, and drug development processes.

departments.name: Clinical Pharmacy and Therapeutics
departments.head: Dr. Huda Sherif
departments.description: This department emphasizes patient care and therapeutic drug monitoring, focusing on the integration of pharmaceutical science with clinical practice. Students work closely with healthcare teams to optimize drug therapy for individual patients.

departments.name: Pharmaceutical Chemistry
departments.head: Dr. Ayman Sobhy
departments.description: This department explores the chemical design and synthesis of pharmaceutical compounds. Students learn about molecular modeling, drug synthesis, and analytical methods used to ensure drug quality and efficacy.

departments.name: Pharmaceutics and Industrial Pharmacy
departments.head: Dr. Mona Galal
departments.description: Focused on the formulation and manufacturing of pharmaceutical products, this department blends science and engineering principles to ensure the stability, delivery, and production of effective medicines.

faculties.WhyUs:
The Faculty of Informatics and Computer Science at the British University in Egypt is an effective and modern Faculty offering a diverse range of specializations. The overall mission of the Faculty is to provide Egypt and the Middle East with the highest quality of British education, and to prepare graduates that feed and stimulate industry and commercial activities.
In 2017, the Faculty of Informatics and Computer is the first private Faculty that acquires the National Authority for Quality Assurance and Accreditation of Education (NAQAAE).
The program offers a broad understanding of Informatics and Computer Science and allows you to specialize in one of the following specific areas:
Computer Science (CS): is based on logical thinking and programming. It has full coverage of computer science modules and skills.
Software Engineering (SE): combines the science and technology of design, as well as the implementation and maintenance of software. Software engineering program prepares the students to apply a structured approach to the development of a software.
Computer Networks (CN): is designed to give you knowledge of both wired and wireless technology to enable you to enter a career in this fast-paced industry.
Information Systems (IS): covers key business modules, which enables the students to be fully aware of what is going on in the industry field. It gives the student a hand on how to model a business process and analyze it.
Artificial Intelligent (AI): Understand and effectively apply main artificial intelligence and robotics knowledge, to solve different real life problems intelligently and efficiently.
Graduates earn two degrees awarded by both the British University in Egypt and London South Bank University (UK).

With expertise in network security, cloud infrastructure, and system administration, Dr. Lotfy ensures that the lab is equipped with the latest technology to support students' learning. She has a strong background in software testing, process improvement, and quality frameworks like ISO and CMMI. Her dedication to continuous improvement has elevated the department’s accreditation achievements. doctors.name: Dr. Mohamed Elserafy
doctors.bio: Dr. Mohamed Elserafy is an Assistant Professor in the Bioinformatics Department, specializing in computational biology and genetic data analysis. He has led multiple interdisciplinary research teams focusing on genomics and personalized medicine. Dr. Elserafy integrates programming and biology to teach modern bioinformatics tools. He is a recipient of national research grants and has published extensively in peer-reviewed journals. His academic interests also include big data processing in healthcare.
